data.sentence: The word وَمَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: command/order/enjoin, authority/power/dominion, counselled/advised/consulted, hold/appoint command, preside as a commander/governor/prince/king, experienced, become many/abundant.
data.sentence: The word أَمْرُنَا comes from the root ا م ر and is associated with the meanings: command/order/enjoin, authority/power/dominion, counselled/advised/consulted, hold/appoint command, preside as a commander/governor/prince/king, experienced, become many/abundant.

data.meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.
data.sentence: The word وَاحِدَةٌ comes from the root و ح د and is associated with the meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.

data.meanings: To shine, glister, give a glance with the eye, twinkling (of an eye). lamaha vb.
data.sentence: The word كَلَمْحٍ comes from the root ل م ح and is associated with the meanings: To shine, glister, give a glance with the eye, twinkling (of an eye). lamaha vb.

data.meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
data.sentence: The word بِالْبَصَرِ comes from the root ب ص ر and is associated with the meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
